text: Nameplate capacity, also known as the rated capacity, nominal capacity, installed capacity, or maximum effect, is the intended full-load sustained output of a facility such as a power station,Energy glossary Energy Information Administration. Nameplate capacity is the number registered with government authorities for classifying the power output of a power station; it is usually written in megawatts (MW).Certificate of Nameplate Capacity Ohio Department of Development. Retrieved: 23 September 2010. Power plants with an output consistently near their nameplate capacity have a high capacity factor. ==References== Category:Electricity
